newsitem.title: UK: LME copper finds support and bounces to end stable.
newsitem.headline: LME copper finds support and bounces to end stable.

text.p: Light bouts of short-covering and speculative buying aided a bounce in copper prices by Wednesday's London Metal Exchange (LME) close, though prices remained firmly entrenched in recent ranges.
Three months delivery rallied from a low of $1,915 to close at $1,936, little moved from Tuesday's LME kerb close of $1,931.

Traders said support around the $1,915/16 continued to hold but noted the recovery from this area have become less pronounced. "In technical terms the bounces from around $1,915 are becoming smaller which is giving a bearish overtone to the market," one LME trader said.
But he doubted there would be any significant downside pressure ahead of the long U.K. holiday this weekend.
Others agreed saying there was reasonable support from $1,910 down to $1,900.
"Short-term the market remains in a sideways pattern," one trader commented.
A lack of fundamental news amid the summer slowdown has seen copper in apathetic mood recently, a condition which has seen the nearby spreads dictate market movements.
Earlier the well-watched cash to three months backwardation eased to around a $38 back, before recovering to settle at $41.
This was well below the $100 level that prevailed a month ago, but traders believe the spread has the potential to widen in the near term as the summer lull draws to a close and supplies tighten.
Other metals were also quiet and largely matched the gyrations of the copper contract.

Aluminium held within its $1,480/$1,500 range and was last at $1,490, up $1. Traders said they expected aluminium to consolidate but did not rule out fresh consumer buying in September which could have the potential to move prices higher.
Zinc held lower levels after Tuesday's poor chart close.
Nickel settled higher at $7,250 on the back of fresh trade and merchant buying. It closed Tuesday at $7,185.
Lead was $4 lower at $820, while tin was down $10 at $6,150.
